CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: In contrast , as evidenced in the results of the DFT calculations for (BDTT-DPP)-(BDTT-TPD)-(BDTT-DPP) , the electron distribution in the HOMO and LUMO wave functions is similar to those of ( BDTT - DPP ) 3 and ( BDTT - TPD ) 3 ( Figures 5a,b ).

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| BDTT-DPP |
| BDTT-TPD |
| BDTT-DPP |
| BDTT-DPP |
| BDTT-TPD |
| BDTT-DPP |

Note: BDTT stands for "benzodithiophene" and DPP stands for "diketopyrrolopyrole" and TPD stands for "triphenylene".

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| BDTT-DPP |
| BDTT-TPD |

The following entities do not clearly refer to material names and were removed:

* "HOMO" (abbreviation for "highest occupied molecular orbital")
* "LUMO" (abbreviation for "lowest unoccupied molecular orbital")
* "DFT calculations" (abbreviation for "density functional theory calculations")
* "Figures 5a,b" (referring to figures in a diagram, not material names)
